intro: Blepharis carduacea, commonly known as the common blepharis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Blepharis carduacea is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
